results.title: Malaysia: land of contrasts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
A two part tour of Malaysia. Part 1: Kuala Lumpur, Cameron Highlands, Kuantan & Terengganu. A survey of the temples, shopping centres and gardens of the Malaysian capital, Kuala Lumpur; the jungle walks and hill stations of the Cameron Highlands, and the beautiful beaches of Pahang, Kuantan and Terengganu. Part 2: Penang, Ipoh, Genting Highlands, Negeri Sembilan & Melaka. The tour continues through the cities of Penang, Ipoh and Melaka and the palaces and castles of Negeri Sembilan and the Genting Highlands.

results.title: Bangkok - the City of Angels/the Kingdom of Thailand
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Colin Baker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
Bangkok: The City of Angels - Bangkok, capital of the Kingdom of Thailand is one of Asia’s most popular destinations. Enjoy the breathtaking Royal Palace, the ornate Royal Barges and Bangkok’s beautiful temples, the magic of the Viman Mek Teak Palace - “The Castle in the Clouds”, the world’s largest golden teak structure, the bustle of the Floating Markets, the ancient capital of Atyutthaya, the beautiful River Kwai (with its famous bridge), visit the Rose Garden and enjoy its exuberant and lavish stage presentation, complete with elephant show. Bangkok is famous for its food and shopping, contrast the tempo and excitement of modern day Bangkok, with the tranquil splendour of the Ancient City. “The Kingdom of Thailand” - Siam, as it was once known, with its delightful people, offers the traveller unlimited attractions - the fun and sun of Pattaya, the beauty of Chiang Mai, “Thailand’s Northern Shangri-la” with visits to the Hill Tribes and elephant camps, visit Chiang Rai and the famed Golden Triangle and join the wedding celebrations of a remote Hill tribe. Rated: G

results.title: Hong Kong the Fragrant Harbour & Macau City
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Colin Baker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
Hong Kong, one of the most exciting destinations in the Orient. Contrast the historic past with the vibrant present. Explore old Hong Kong with its shops, stalls and diverse merchandise, ancient temples, the bird restaurant, the Jade market. See the wonderful harbour, surveyed by Victoria Peak and the outlying islands. The floating village of sampan dwellers - Aberdeen with its famed floating restaurants, and the delightful Ocean Park with its many attractions. Macau, the extraordinary and colourful Portuguese colony, a mere dot on the map of China, and one of the first gateways to the, then unknown, Celestial Kingdom of China. This fascinating colony where East and West blend so easily, has an incredible history. Apart from its rich history, Macau offers visitors the opportunity to try their luck with 24 hour casinos, a wide variety of restaurants, excellent shopping and a charming and friendly people. Rated: G

results.title: 3 years = Three years
results.brief_description: For Calvin, joining up with Green Corps when he was 20 proved to be a turning point in his life. Motivated and inspired by the people he met in Green Corps, three years on, he is now successfully employed, confident and making the most of every opportunity that comes his way.

results.title: Face to face
results.brief_description: Coming face to face with my dad after a very long absence made me realise just how much I missed growing up without a father in my life.

results.title: Spun out
results.brief_description: Serious illness not only can bring a family closer together but it can make them stronger and more willing to accept alternative options when the traditional way is just not working. Life can be tough but the joy is in seeing your loved ones recovering.

results.title: Just for dad
results.brief_description: My Dad means a lot to me. He works in Western Australia now, so I don’t get to see him as much as I used to. This story is a tribute to my Dad.

results.title: Home
results.brief_description: As a child home was just an illusion. Growing up, moving overseas, home became temperal and Australia became “just back home” and on returning home, nothing made sense - everything had changed. Perhaps my mother’s words that “home is where the heart is” says it all.
